content.description: Sit start at the far right side of the boulder, and move up and left on decent ripples. Get the round knob way out left on the steep arête, then pop to a crimp bar, and top out over the prow.
content.location: The far right side of the boulder on the biggest boulder in the Old Pen area.

content.description: Sit start using the rock pedestal, and move up on crimps to exit.
content.location: This is in a small alcove on your left about 15-20 feet behind the biggest boulder in the Old Pen Area.

content.description:
This is an obvious problem that has undoubtedly been climbed before (probably in era when boulder problems were rarely named).  Also, it is one of the funner problems in these parts.  I named it after a red-eyed vireo flitting about nearby.   

  Start down as low as you can on the right and traverse to the crimpy rail in the upper left corner then top out.  It has bad feet but decent hands.  Smaller climbers will have to work a little harder for this one.
content.protection: The landing is good.  So is the topout once you set your feet.
content.location: The face is located right be the new trail and is fairly obvious.   Friction and lichen pinch down the back of this boulder.

content.description: Stand start the shallow left arête on the biggest boulder in the area. This has tricky beta.
content.location: It is on the left side of the biggest boulder in the Old Pen area.

content.description:
This the first area you come to walking in from the pipeline and probably has the most concentrated section of rocks few of which are climbable.    

  There are stonewalls in this section of Redrock and it looks as if this area could have been used as a pen at one time.
